Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the dining room
The dining room.

The center of the dining room is taken up by a large, black-lacquered oak table, covered in a gleaming white tablecloth. The table is set on an oriental rug; chairs surround the table. A fireplace set in the middle of the south wall crackles merrily, creating an antidote to the darkness beyond the windows.
http://www.skotos.net/MansionGame/images/DiningRoom.jpg
the eastern door
Near the southern end of the eastern wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob is attached to the edge of the door.
the western door
Near the southern end of the western wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob and lock are attached to the edge of the door.
the chairs around the dining table
Black-lacquered, tall-backed Georgian style dining room chairs.
Black-lacquered Georgian style dining room chairs.
back of a dining room chair
The tall, narrow back of a black Georgian dining room chair.
The tall, narrow back of a dining room chair.
dining room chair's leg
The legs of a black-lacquered dining room chair.
The legs of a dining room chair.
dining room chair's seat
The Georgian dining room chair's seat is cushioned with black leather.
The dining room chair's seat is cushioned with black leather.
the east curtains
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the east window are swept back by brass hold-backs.
the north curtains
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the north window are swept back by brass hold-backs.
the west curtains
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the west window are swept back by brass hold-backs.
the fire
A crackling fire is warming the dining room from within the fireplace.
the fireplace
A classicly simple fireplace is built into the south wall, with a plain mantel and smooth, unmarked chimney front. Within the hearth is a crackling fire.
the curtain holdbacks
The heavy fabric of the curtains around the east window are swept back by hold-backs: curved brass hooks mounted low on the edges of the windows.
the chimney front
A plain, smooth chimney front of cream plaster rises from the mantel to the ceiling.
the mantel
The fireplace mantel is a plain, smooth ledge or shelf above the hearth, below the hood.
the large oriental rug on the floor
This is a large, rectangular, oriental rug with bright designs woven into it. It is lying on the center of the floor; the table is standing on it.
A large oriental rug, upon which the table is standing.
An oriental rug covered with bright designs.
the oriental rug's edges
The tasselled sides of an oriental rug.
the oriental rug's center
The center of an oriental rug, under the table.
the black-lacquered oak dining table
This is a long, black-lacquered oak dining table, in the middle of the room. A gleaming white tablecloth is laid on it; chairs surround it.
This is a long, black-lacquered oak dining table, set in the middle of the room.
the dinner table's tablecloth
The gleaming white tablecloth, covering the table.
The white tablecloth.
the dining table's edge
The edge of the top of a long black-lacquered dining table.
The edge of the oak dining table.
the dining table's end
The end of a black-lacquered oak dinner table.
The end of an dining table.
the dining table's legs
The four round legs of a black-lacquered oak dining table.
The four legs of a dining table.
the dinner table's center
The center of the black-lacquered oak dinner table, covered by a white table cloth.
The center of the dinner table, covered by a white table cloth.
the view of the rear lawn through the northern and western windows
Through the windows, you can see:
Through the windows, you can see:
the view of the porch through the eastern window
Through the eastern window, you can see:
Through the eastern window, you can see:
the east wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the east wall of the dining room; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in this wall, near the southern end; a single curtained window is also set in the wall, looking out onto the porch.
the north wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the north wall of the dining room; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall. A wide, curtained window is set in the middle of this wall; past the clean, reflective glass you have a view of the dark back lawn.
the south wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the south wall of the dining room; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. A plain fireplace is built into the middle of the wall.
the west wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the west wall of the dining room; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in the wall, near its southern end; a curtained window is set in the northern half, looking out onto the dark back lawn.
the curtained east window
A window is set in the east wall; white curtains are swept back from the window by brass hold-backs. Through the window, you have a view of the rear porch of the mansion.
the curtained north window
A wide window is set in the middle of the north wall; white curtains are swept back from the window by brass hold-backs. Through the window, you have a view of the rear lawn of the mansion.
the curtained west window
A window is set in the west wall; white curtains are swept back from the window by brass hold-backs. Through this window, you have a view of the back lawn of the mansion.

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: The dining room of the mansion.
